titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Silas Horton Stringham papers 1978.052
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-01-05 19:39:48 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: This collection spans the period 1861 to 1889 and contains documents regarding the estate of naval officer Silas H. Stringham as well as a letter of recommendation from the Navy.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of the New Canaan Historical Society, 1975.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Silas Horton Stringham (November 7, 1798-February 7, 1876) was an officer in the United States Navy and lived at 124 Hicks Street in Brooklyn.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Silas Horton Stringham papers, 1978.052, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection spans the period 1861 to 1889 and contains documents regarding the estate of naval officer Silas H. Stringham as well as a letter of recommendation from the Navy.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
